title: How to write positive comments for students - Quora

response.answer_text: I assume this is for report cards? We’re told to avoid unquantifiable claims, things like saying the student is “good natured” — what the heck does that mean? We’re told to be precise in our praise and in our “next steps” section. For example: instead of saying, “Amir is a great help to his classmates” I would write, “Amir consistently volunteers to help his classmates, particularly in math class, by not giving the answer but instead by showing his notes and actually bringing his classmates to the board to look at the explanation closely.” Yeah, it’s much larger but it also is far more specific and precise. It also avoid words like great because those are really hard to quantify. I can however factually state that he helps his classmates because I have seen him do it and how.
